content: With the current deployment, I like that the PMs are now in 'recent topics', though maybe 'recent conversations' would be (now) more appropriate :)
Yeah the plan is to do that in whichever release this gets merged in.
Sorting by stream or topic looks totally broken after this change. @shlok (madrix01) FYI
I guess we should put "Private messages" at the top of the sort by stream order; that's probably more useful than any other approach.

The unread markers look misaligned horizontally:

Screen-Shot-2022-09-17-at-8.09.27-PM.png
@shlok (madrix01) do you think you'll be able to fix the couple bugs reported here soon?
Yes, I'll fix it as soon as possible. Sorry was busy with some tests.
@Tim Abbott stream sorting should be case sensitive or not?
I don't think there will be any significance of case sensitive, currently i'm not making it case sensitive.
@Tim Abbott I have pushed new change which solves the sorting and alignment bugs.
@shlok (madrix01) stream sorting should be case-insensitive; that's how it is the left sidebar.
I'm updating the deployment, since both of these bugs were fairly visible.
Hm, is it intentional that sorting by topic puts all the PMs on top? I would probably expect PM conversations to be alphabetized using the names, and interspersed with stream conversations.

Hm, is it intentional that sorting by topic puts all the PMs on top?

Yes.
Okay, I'll the make the mentioned changes.
But it would be a little confusing in the interspersed view with topic and groups
Hm, why do you think it would be confusing? They are interspersed in the default order (by recency)...
But after sorting it with topics, one would have to refer to the stream column as there is no visible differentiation between Topics and Groups.
PMs have an icon/presence dot on the left of the topic column. Also, again, isn't this the same situation as in the default ordering?
Oh okay, I'll make the required changes and push the new code.
I have push the update code, can you redeploy it?
Unread counters look better aligned between topics and PMs now :+1:

There is a bug where the "Include PMs" is not disabled for logged out users. We should have it disabled and unchecked like the other filters. @shlok (madrix01) would you be up for pushing a fix?

Screen-Shot-2022-09-26-at-12.33.06-AM.png
I'll push the fix today
I have pushed the fix Alya Abbott
Any more feedback here? If not, we can push on integrating this change and renaming Recent topics to Recent conversations.
@Neil Pilgrim (neiljp) FYI in case that has any implications for the Terminal app.

Terminal doesn't support recent topics/conversations, so this doesn't significantly affect us unless it's a backend change?
(we already had t for another feature when it was introduced)

Or was it a specific different point you wanted feedback on?
Yeah, that's all I wanted to check on -- thanks!
Thanks for mentioning they keyboard shortcut! We may want to keep it as t to make the transition easier for existing users, but it's not super clear why it should be t once it's been renamed.

@shlok (madrix01) I just noticed another bug, where the PMs filter isn't highlighted the way the others are when it's selected (this is on CZO):

Screen-Shot-2022-10-04-at-3.35.28-PM.png
Are you up for fixing that? We should make sure it's fixed in both light and dark theme, and that it doesn't cause some other regression (e.g. for the logged out view).
I'll fix it Today, thanks for pointing this out
I have pushed the fix @Alya Abbott
Do folks have any general feedback on this feature since getting a chance to try it on CZO?

I've been glad to see this feature!

I don't think I have any more specific feedback than that.

I don't visit the community server often, but I noticed it immediately when I popped in a couple of days ago and I love the idea. Haven't had much of an opportunity to use in practice yet though. I am pretty excited for it to roll out to my server in a future update!

@shlok (madrix01) probably has seen this, but I posted a pretty detailed technical review of this PR yesterday. Most of the comments are just improvements to variable/function names and a bit of code deduplication, so I think it has a good chance of merging in the next week if he has the time to dedicate to it.
Also worth mentioning that I deployed the latest version of this PR here yesterday; forgot to transcribe that.
Hey, thanks for the review I'll update the PR according to your comments in this couple of days.
